Package gameaudio

Class AudioPlayer

java.lang.Object
gameaudio.AudioPlayer
public class AudioPlayer extends Object
Audio Player is a class that allows WAV files to be played through the use of Java CLIPS. The songs are loaded into an array which finds the files in the correct folder, and then converts those WAV files into a format that java can understand, saving them into a new array. From this new array, they are able to be accessed and played at any time.
Author:
John Botonakis

      An array of Clip objects storing effect sounds, labeled "fx"

    • songMute

      private boolean songMute
      A boolean value to mute songs. True is mute, False is unmute

    • effectMute

      private boolean effectMute
      A boolean value to mute effects. True is mute, False is unmute

    • volume

      private float volume
      Sets the volume for every sound that will be played. 1f is 100% volume, 0f is 0% volume.

  • Constructor Details

    • AudioPlayer

      public AudioPlayer()
      The main constructor for the Audio player class. It loads in the Songs first, then the Effects, then plays the Main Menu music as it is the first to load in when starting the program.

  • Method Details

    • loadSong

      public void loadSong()
      Loads the music audio into an array for easier fetching. The array stores these audio files as Clip objects

    • loadEffect

      public void loadEffect()
      Loads in the SFX audio into an array for easier fetching. The array stores these SFX files as Clip objects

    • getSound

      private Clip getSound(String name)
      Loads in the audio file as a Clip object by first getting the resource as a URL file
      Parameters:
      name - - Name of clip to load in
      Returns:
      The audio file

    • setSongVolume

      public void setSongVolume(float volume)
      Adjusts the volume for the songs
      Parameters:
      volume - - The float volume level

    • stopSong

      public void stopSong()
      Stops the currently playing song

    • setLevelSong

      public void setLevelSong(int lvlIndex)
      Sets the Level music based on the current level index
      Parameters:
      lvlIndex - - The index of the level that corresponds to the selected song

    • lvlCompleted

      public void lvlCompleted()
      Stops whatever song is currently playing, and switches to the LEVELCOMPLETE song

    • playAttackSound

      public void playAttackSound()
      Plays the SFX for attacking

    • playEffect

      public void playEffect(int effect)
      Plays other sound effects
      Parameters:
      effect - - The sound index that is to be played

    • playSong

      public void playSong(int song)
      Plays the passed in Song, and will loop
      Parameters:
      song - - The integer value of the song you wish to play

    • toggleSongMute

      public void toggleSongMute()
      Mutes all current Songs by passing in a boolean Control value of type MUTE.

    • toggleEffectMute

      public void toggleEffectMute()
      Mutes all sound effects by passing in a boolean control value of type MUTE.

    • updateSongVolume

      private void updateSongVolume()
      Updates the currently playing song's volume as a float.
